calendar_conflicts: Golf with Jacob at 11:10 (30 min away)
Need to leave by 10:00 for warmup
context_analysis.energy_patterns: Energy level 7/10 indicates good capacity for focused work. Weekend context suggests more relaxed pacing with breaks between tasks.
strategic_priorities: Maintain weekend balance with golf social activity

reasoning.scheduling_strategy: Front-load echo development work in the morning (6:00-9:30) to leverage fresh energy before golf. Post-golf afternoon for home tasks and grocery shopping. Evening buffer for final tidying before Hunter arrives.
reasoning.energy_optimization: Start with high-focus echo work during peak morning hours. Use post-golf lower energy for physical tasks (tidying, shopping). Build in transition time between activities to maintain weekend pace.
reasoning.priority_sequencing: 1) Echo project work (highest priority, best energy), 2) Golf commitment (fixed time), 3) Home preparation (office, bathroom), 4) Grocery shopping (if time allows)
reasoning.recovery_planning: 30-min breaks after intense coding session and after returning from golf. Light evening activities after shopping. Full wind-down starting 21:00 before Hunter's arrival.

schedule.note: Put away groceries, final home prep

schedule.note: Light development work - review progress, document MVP

schedule.title: Evening | Wind Down & Hunter Arrival
schedule.note: Relax and prepare for Hunter's arrival at 22:00

key_insights: Front-loaded echo development in peak morning hours maximizes progress on MVP
Golf commitment creates natural break and social balance in weekend schedule
Afternoon allocated for all home prep tasks ensuring ready for Hunter's arrival
Built-in flexibility for grocery shopping based on time availability
Evening includes light echo work option if energy permits after physical tasks
